trans-unit.source: Represents a Windows status bar control.

Although <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripStatusLabel"></xref> replaces and adds functionality to the StatusBar control of previous versions, StatusBar is retained for both backward compatibility and future use if you choose.
Typically, a StatusBar control consists of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> objects, each of which displays text and/or an icon.
You can also provide owner-drawn panels to provide custom panels such as a progress bar or a series of images that displays the state of your application.

A StatusBar control typically displays information about an object being viewed on a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form>, the object's components, or contextual information that relates to that object's operation within your application.
The StatusBar control provides properties that enable you to customize the appearance of the control.

If the StatusBar is displayed on a form that can be resized, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.SizingGrip%2A> property to display a sizing grip in the lower-right corner of the form to indicate to users that the form can be resized.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.ShowPanels%2A> property enables you to display panels within your StatusBar or to display only the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Text%2A> property of the control.
The default StatusBar has no panels.

To add panels to a StatusBar you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.Add%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection> class that is accessible through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.Panels%2A> property of the control.

You can also use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection> object provided through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.Panels%2A> property to remove panels from the control and access a specific <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> to manipulate the panel.

If you want to determine when a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> object within a StatusBar control is clicked, you can create an event handler for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.PanelClick> event.
To perform owner-draw operations on a panel, you can create an event handler for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.DrawItem> event.
The event data passed to the event handler provides information on the panel to draw and a <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object to use to perform drawing tasks.
When you create an instance of StatusBar, the read/write properties are set to initial values.
For a list of these values, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar"></xref> class.
The default <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> has no panels.
When you create an instance of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar>, the following read/write properties are set to initial values.

|Property|Initial value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Dock%2A>|<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DockStyle>| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.ShowPanels%2A>|`false`| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.SizingGrip%2A>|`true`| You can change the value for any of these properties through a separate call to the property.
Gets or sets the background color for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar"></xref>.
This is an ambient property and will always return a non-null value.
This property is not relevant for this class.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that is the background color of the control
Occurs when the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.BackColor*> property changes.
To be added.
Gets or sets the background image for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar"></xref>.

Setting the background image for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> has no effect on the appearance of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control, therefore it is not shown in the designer or by IntelliSense.
An <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> that is the background image for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar"></xref>.
Occurs when the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.BackgroundImage*> property is changed.
For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
This event is not relevant for this class.
This event is not relevant for this class.
To be added.
Gets or sets the layout of the background image of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar"></xref>.
Setting the BackgroundImageLayout has no effect on the appearance of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control, therefore it is not shown in the designer or by IntelliSense.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageLayout"></xref> values.
Occurs when the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.BackgroundImageLayout*> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
This event is not relevant for this class.
To be added.
Overrides <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.CreateHandle*>.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams"></xref> used to create the handle for this control.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams"></xref> used to create the handle for this control.
Gets the default Input Method Editor (IME) mode supported by this control.
As implemented in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> class, this property always returns the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImeMode?displayProperty=fullName> value.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImeMode"></xref> values.
Gets the default size of the control.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> that represents the size of the control.
Disposes of the resources (other than memory) used by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar"></xref>.
This method is called by the public `Dispose` method and the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method.
`Dispose` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`.
<xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> invokes `Dispose` with `disposing` set to `false`.
When the `disposing` parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> references.
This method invokes the `Dispose` method of each referenced object.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to release both managed and unmanaged resources; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to release only unmanaged resources.
Gets or sets the docking behavior of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar"></xref> control.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DockStyle"></xref> values.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_Bottom" name="Bottom" href=""></xref>.

Gets or sets a value indicating whether this control should redraw its surface using a secondary buffer to reduce or prevent flicker, however this property has no effect on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar"></xref> control
Setting this property has no effect on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control, therefore it is not shown in the designer or by IntelliSense.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the control has a secondary buffer; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Occurs when a visual aspect of an owner-drawn status bar control changes.
You can use this event to perform drawing operations in an owner-drawn <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control.
For example, if you display an owner-drawn <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> that displays a progress bar, you can use this event to perform the drawing of the progress bar on the panel.

The data provided to the event through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarDrawItemEventArgs> object passed as a parameter to the event handler enables you to determine the panel that needs to be drawn and the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> to use to draw to the panel.

This event is only raised when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel.Style%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanelStyle>.
For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
Gets or sets the font the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar"></xref> control will use to display information.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> of the text.
The default is the font of the container, unless you override it.
Gets or sets the forecolor for the control.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that represents the forecolor of the control.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_Empty" name="Empty" href=""></xref>.
Occurs when the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.ForeColor*> property changes.
To be added.
Gets or sets the Input Method Editor (IME) mode supported by this control.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImeMode"></xref> values.
Occurs when the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.ImeMode*> property changes.
To be added.
Raises the OnDrawItem event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnDrawItem method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarDrawItemEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.HandleCreated"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
> [!NOTE] > When overriding OnHandleCreated in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnHandleCreated%2A> method.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.HandleDestroyed"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref uid="langword_csharp_Layout" name="Layout" href=""></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
A <xref uid="langword_csharp_LayoutEventArgs" name="LayoutEventArgs" href=""></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the OnMouseDown event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the OnPanelClick event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnPanelClick method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanelClickEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the OnResize event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For an overview, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar"></xref> control is redrawn.
To be added.
Occurs when a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> object on a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar"></xref> control is clicked.
You can use this event to perform tasks when a panel within a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control is clicked.

The data provided to the event through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanelClickEventArgs> passed as a parameter to the event handler enables you to determine the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> that was clicked by the user in order to perform tasks on the selected panel.
For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
Gets the collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar"></xref> panels contained within the control.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control can display a number of panels to provide information to the user of your application.
For example, a panel could display the current time or the progress of a file download.
Each panel displayed by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control is an instance of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> class.

The Panels property enables you to obtain a reference to the collection of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> objects that are currently stored in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control.
With this reference, you can add panels, remove panels, access a specific panel within the collection, and obtain a count of the panels in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control.
For more information on the tasks that can be performed with the panel collection, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection> class reference topics.

A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection> containing the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel"></xref> objects of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar"></xref> control.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether any panels that have been added to the control are displayed.
By default, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control displays the value of its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Text%2A> property without any panels.
When `ShowPanels` is set to `true`, any <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> objects specified in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control are displayed.
No panels are initially created when you create an instance of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> class.

You can add panels to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control by using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection.Add%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.StatusBarPanelCollection> class.
This collection class can be accessed through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar.Panels%2A> property of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar>.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if panels are displayed; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether a sizing grip is displayed in the lower-right corner of the control.
You can use this property to display a sizing grip to provide an indication to the user when a form is resizable.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.FormBorderStyle%2A> property of your <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form> is set to a border style that is not resizable, such as<xref:System.Windows.Forms.FormBorderStyle> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FormBorderStyle>, you should set the SizingGrip property to `false` to prevent the user from thinking that the form can be resized.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if a sizing grip is displayed; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user will be able to tab to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar"></xref>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the tab key moves focus to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar"></xref>; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the text associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar"></xref> control.
This property represents the text displayed by the control.
> [!CAUTION] > The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar> control displays only the first 127 characters of a string.
The text associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.StatusBar"></xref> control.
Returns a string representation for this control.
String
Processes Windows messages.
The Windows <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Message"></xref> to process.
